metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000246 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.description:
Python package pysaml2 version 4.4.0 and earlier reuses the initialization vector across encryptions in the IDP server, resulting in weak encryption of data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-1000246` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pysaml2 - 4.5.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> The discussion in the GitHub issue explains why this isn't currently an issue but could be in the future if new cipher modes are used.

criterions.comment: python-pysaml2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu2').
